column2: (french: [abdublatif keuiu]; tunisian arabic: uuuf uuuuuau uuuauue, born  december ) is a tunisian-french actor, film director and screenwriter. he made his directorial debut in  with la faute ue voltaire, which he also wrote. his film blue is the warmest colour won the palme d'or at the  cannes film festival.

(french: [guus];  october  u  november ) was a french film director and producer, writer and actor. a pioneer in the theory and practice of montage, he is best known for three major silent films: j'accuse (), la roue (), and the monumental napolueon ().

agnues  (french: [auubs vauda]; born  may ) is a film director who was born in belgium, but has spent most of her working life in france. her films, photographs, and art installations focus on documentary realism, feminist issues, and social commentary with a distinct experimental style.nfilm historians have cited 's work as central to the development of the french new wave film movement; her uses of location shooting and non-professional actors were unconventional in the context of s french cinema.
olavi kaurismueki (finnish: [ucuki uckuurismueki]; born  april ) is a finnish screenwriter and film director.nn

(ueduca ue, march ,  u september , ) was a japanese film director and screenwriter. regarded as one of the most important and influential filmmakers in the history of cinema, he directed  films in a career spanning  years.n entered the japanese film industry in , following a brief stint as a painter. after years of working on numerous films as an assistant director and scriptwriter, he made his debut as a director during world war ii with the popular action film sanshiro sugata (a.k.a. judo saga). after the war, the critically acclaimed drunken angel (), in which  cast then-unknown actor toshiro mifune in a starring role, cemented the director's reputation as one of the most important young filmmakers in japan. the two men would go on to collaborate on another  films.nrashomon, which premiered in tokyo, became the surprise winner of the golden lion at the  venice film festival. the commercial and critical success of that film opened up western film markets for the first time to the products of the japanese film industry, which in turn led to international recognition for other japanese filmmakers. throughout the s and early s,  directed approximately a film a year, including a number of highly regarded (and often adapted) films, such as ikiru (), seven samurai () and yojimbo (). after the s, he became much less prolific, though his later workuincluding his final two epics, kagemusha () and ran ()ucontinued to win awards though more often abroad than in japan.nin , he accepted the academy award for lifetime achievement. posthumously, he was named "asian of the century" in the "arts, literature, and culture" category by asianweek magazine and cnn, cited there as being among the five people who most prominently contributed to the improvement of asia in the past century. his career has been honored by many retrospectives, critical studies and biographies in both print and video, and by releases in many consumer media formats.
(french: [kavalje]; born  september ) is a french film director.nn

(french: [alubu uubnub];  june  u  march ) was a french film director and screenwriter whose career extended over more than six decades. after training as a film editor in the mid-s, he went on to direct a number of short films which included night and fog (), an influential documentary about the nazi concentration camps.n began making feature films in the late s and consolidated his early reputation with hiroshima mon amour (), last year at marienbad (), and muriel (), all of which adopted unconventional narrative techniques to deal with themes of troubled memory and the imagined past. these films were contemporary with, and associated with, the french new wave (la nouvelle vague), though  did not regard himself as being fully part of that movement. he had closer links to the "left bank" group of authors and filmmakers who shared a commitment to modernism and an interest in left-wing politics. he also established a regular practice of working on his films in collaboration with writers previously unconnected with the cinema such as jean cayrol, marguerite duras,  robbe-grillet, jorge semprufan and jacques sternberg.nin later films,  moved away from the overtly political topics of some previous works and developed his interests in an interaction between cinema and other cultural forms, including theatre, music, and comic books. this led to imaginative adaptations of plays by alan ayckbourn, henri bernstein and jean anouilh, as well as films featuring various kinds of popular song.nhis films frequently explore the relationship between consciousness, memory, and the imagination, and he was noted for devising innovative formal structures for his narratives. throughout his career, he won many awards from international film festivals and academies.

(french: [a.lubu uub uui.jub];  august  u  february ) was a french writer and filmmaker. he was one of the figures most associated with the nouveau roman (new novel) trend of the s, along with nathalie sarraute, michel butor and claude simon.   was elected a member of the acaduemie franueaise on  march , succeeding maurice rheims at seat no. . he was married to catherine  (nuee rstakian).
(august ,  u july , ) was an american stage actor and film director.

(french: [lamuuis];  january  u  june ) was a french filmmaker, film producer, and writer, who is best known for his award-winning short films which he began making in the late s, and also for inventing the famous strategic board game risk in .

(september ,  u may , ) was an american film director, producer, and screenwriter.nhe was born in brooklyn, new york and raised in newark, new jersey. he earned a master's degree at harvard and taught english at the university of missouri. during world war i, he served in the military and was afterwards appointed assistant national director of the american jewish relief committee. he later became a drama and film critic for the jewish tribune until the early s, when he went to hollywood to become a reader for samuel goldwyn. later he worked as a script clerk for directors king vidor and victor sjufstrufm before becoming a screenwriter at mgm in .n was appointed head of the studio's script department and by the late s was irving thalberg's personal assistant and closest associate. nominally credited as an associate producer, he produced several of mgm's most important films of the s. after thalberg's death, he joined paramount as a producer in , where he remained until . notable producing credits during this period include true confession (), spawn of the north (), zaza () and so ends our night ().nin ,  began to direct. he made six films, writing all of them and producing several himself. as a director and writer, he showed literary and cultural aspirations in the selection and treatment of his themes. in ,  published a novel, the unaltered cat.

fernando amenuebar cantos (born march , ), commonly known as  amenuebar, is a spanish and chilean film director, screenwriter and composer. among other honors, he has won nine goyas, two european film awards and an oscar. he has written or co-written the screenplays to all six of his movies and composed almost all of the soundtracks.

gonzuelez iufuerritu (american spanish: [aleucxandueo gonucsales iucuaritu]; credited since  as  g. iufuerritu; born august , ) is a mexican film director, producer, and screenwriter. he is the first mexican director to be nominated for the academy award for best director and the directors guild of america award for outstanding directing for babel ().nhe won the academy award for best director, best original screenplay, and best picture for birdman or (the unexpected virtue of ignorance) (). the following year, he won the academy award for best director for the revenant (). he is friends with fellow mexican directors guillermo del toro and alfonso cuarufn, collectively known as "the three amigos of cinema."

prullansky (spanish: [aleucxandueo xoufoucueofski]; born  february ) is a chilean-french film and theatre director, screenwriter, playwright, actor, author, poet, producer, composer, musician, comics writer, and spiritual guru. best known for his avant-garde films, he has been "venerated by cult cinema enthusiasts" for his work which "is filled with violently surreal images and a hybrid blend of mysticism and religious provocation".nborn to jewish-ukrainian parents in chile,  experienced an unhappy and alienated childhood, and so immersed himself in reading and writing poetry. dropping out of college, he became involved in theater and in particular mime, working as a clown before founding his own theater troupe, the teatro mimico, in . moving to paris in the early s,  studied mime under uctienne decroux before turning to cinema, directing the short film les tueates interverties in . from  he divided his time between paris and mexico city, in the former becoming a founding member of the anarchistic avant-garde panic movement of performance artists. in  he created his first comic strip, anibal , while in  he directed his first feature film, the surrealist fando y lis, which caused a huge scandal in mexico, eventually being banned.nhis next film, the acid western el topo (), became a hit on the midnight movie circuit in the united states, considered as the first-ever midnight cult film, garnering high praise from john lennon, which led to  being provided with $ million to finance his next film. the result was the holy mountain (), a surrealist exploration of western esotericism. disagreements with the film's distributor allen klein, however, led to both the holy mountain and el topo failing to gain widespread distribution, although both became classics on the underground film circuit.nafter an aborted attempt at filming frank herbert's  science fiction novel dune,  produced five more films: the family film tusk (); the surrealist horror santa sangre (); the failed blockbuster the rainbow thief (); the dance of reality () and poesueda sin fin (). meanwhile, he has simultaneously written a series of science fiction comic books, most notably the incal (u), which has been described as having a claim to be "the best comic book" ever written, and also the technopriests and metabarons. accompanying this, he has also written books and regularly lectures on his own spiritual system, which he calls "psychomagic" and "psychoshamanism" and which borrows from his interests in alchemy, the tarot, zen buddhism and shamanism. his son cristufbal has followed his teachings on psychoshamanism; this work is captured in the feature documentary quantum men, directed by carlos serrano azcona.

column2: alexander petrovich  or oleksander petrovych  (ukrainian: ueubuuauuuduu ufuuuueuuu uueuuuuduaue, oleksandr petrovych ; russian: uubuuauuuuduu ufuuuueuuuu uueuuuuuduaue,  petrovich ; september  [o.s. august ]  u november , ), was a soviet screenwriter, film producer and director of ukrainian origin. he is often cited as one of the most important early soviet filmmakers, alongside sergei eisenstein, dziga vertov, and vsevolod pudovkin, as well as being a pioneer of soviet montage theory.nn

alexander nikolayevich , par (russian: uubuuauuuuduu uduuaueubuuuuuu uueuauuuueu; born  june ) is a russian filmmaker. his most significant works include a feature film, russian ark (), filmed in a single unedited shot, and faust (), which was honoured with the golden lion, the highest prize for the best film at the venice film festival.

ander "" medawar  (born  may ) is an english novelist, screenwriter, film producer and director. he rose to prominence as a novelist in the late s with his novel the beach which received universal acclaim with many critics lauding  as a key voice of generation x. he subsequently received praise for the screenplays of the films  days later (), sunshine (), never let me go () and dredd ().nin ,  made his directorial debut with ex machina, a science fiction thriller which explored the relationship between mankind and artificial intelligence. us screenplay received critical acclaim and was nominated for the academy award for best original screenplay.

philip ander ""  (born october , ) is an american documentary film director and producer. in , esquire magazine said  "is becoming the most important documentarian of our time".nhis works as director include going clear: scientology and the prison of belief (winner of three emmys in ), we steal secrets: the story of wikileaks, mea maxima culpa: silence in the house of god (the winner of three primetime emmy awards), enron: the smartest guys in the room (nominated in  for academy award for best documentary feature); client : the rise and fall of eliot spitzer (short-listed in  for the academy award for best documentary feature); casino jack and the united states of money; and taxi to the dark side (winner of the  academy award for best documentary feature), focusing on an innocent taxi driver in afghanistan who was tortured and killed at bagram air force base in .

ander ""  (; born  september ) is an australian film director, screenwriter, and producer.  is best known for directing the films the crow (), dark city (), i, robot (), knowing (), and gods of egypt ().
(born new york city, ) is an american film maker, best known for his films about labor, immigration, and politics.
(born  august ) is a dutch screenwriter, film director, and actor. he is also a painter.

cuarufn orozco (spanish pronunciation: [alucfonso kwaucueon]; born november , ) is a mexican film director, screenwriter, producer, and editor best known for his dramas a little princess () and y tu mamue tambiuen (), the fantasy film harry potter and the prisoner of azkaban (), and science fiction thrillers children of men () and gravity (). cuarufn is the first latin american director to win an oscar for best director.nmost of his work has been praised by both audiences and critics, and has been nominated for six academy awards including best original screenplay for y tu mamue tambiuen, and both best adapted screenplay and best film editing for children of men. for gravity, cuarufn received several major accolades for his achievement in direction, winning in the respective categories at the academy awards, the golden globe awards, the bafta awards and the directors guild of america; and in addition winning the bafta award best british film and the academy award for best film editing (shared with mark sanger). he has also been awarded the bafta award for best film not in the english language as one of the producers of pan's labyrinth ().ncuarufn's brother carlos, as well as his son jonues, are also writers and directors and have both acted as co-writers in some of his works. he is also friends with fellow mexican directors guillermo del toro and alejandro gonzuelez iufuerritu, collectively known as "the three amigos of cinema."

sir  joseph  kbe ( august  u  april ) was an english film director and producer, referred to as the "master of suspense". he pioneered many elements of the suspense and psychological thriller genres. he had a successful career in british cinema with both silent films and early talkies and became renowned as england's best director.  moved to hollywood in , and became a u.s. citizen in .n became a highly visible public figure through interviews, film trailers, cameo appearances in his own films, and the ten years in which he hosted the television programme   presents (u). he also fashioned for himself a recognisable directorial style, and the term ian is now often used to refer to his style of filmmaking. 's stylistic trademarks include the use of camera movement that mimics a person's gaze, forcing viewers to engage in a form of voyeurism. in addition, he framed shots to maximise anxiety, fear, or empathy, and used innovative forms of film editing. his work often features fugitives on the run alongside "icy blonde" female characters.nprior to , there had long been talk of  being knighted for his contribution to film. he later received his knighthood from queen elizabeth ii in the  new year honours. he directed more than fifty feature films in a career spanning six decades and is often regarded as one of the most influential directors in cinematic history. his first thriller, the lodger: a story of the london fog (), helped shape the thriller genre in film. his  film, blackmail, is often cited as the first british sound feature film, while rear window (), vertigo (), north by northwest () and psycho () are regularly ranked among the greatest films of all time. he is considered to be one of the greatest and most influential directors in the history of cinema.

rufnnow  born , is a danish author, director and screenwriter. together with the danish author jacob weinreich he is also known as a. j. kazinski. together they have published the last good man and "the sleep and the death".

arsenyevich  (russian: uuduuuuu uuuuuuducuuuu uuuuaueuuuuauu; ipa: [unucdrubej urucsubenubjuavubuatu turuckofskubuaj];  april  u  december ) was a soviet filmmaker, writer, film editor, film theorist, theatre and opera director.n's films include ivan's childhood (),  rublev (), solaris (), mirror (), and stalker (). he directed the first five of his seven feature films in the soviet union; his last two films, nostalghia () and the sacrifice (), were produced in italy and sweden, respectively. his work is characterized by long takes, unconventional dramatic structure, distinctly authored use of cinematography, and spiritual and metaphysical themes.n's works  rublev, mirror, and stalker are regularly listed among the greatest films of all time. his contribution to cinema was so influential that works done in a similar way are described as tarkovskian. ingmar bergman said of him:nn for me is the greatest (director), the one who invented a new language, true to the nature of film, as it captures life as a reflection, life as a dream.

the call of cthulhu is a  independent silent film adaptation of the h. p. lovecraft short story "the call of cthulhu", produced by sean branney and   and distributed by the h. p. lovecraft historical society. it is the first film adaptation of the famous lovecraft story, and uses mythoscope, a blend of vintage and modern filming techniques intended to produce the look of a s-era film. the film is the length of a featurette.nn

m.  (born  june ) is a new zealand screenwriter, producer, and director. he wrote and directed gattaca (), simone (), lord of war (), in time (), the host (), and good kill (). he also wrote and co-produced the truman show, which earned an academy award nomination for best original screenplay in  and won a bafta award for best screenplay. his films tend to explore social, cultural and political issues, as well as artificial realities or simulations.nhis film good kill was selected to compete for the golden lion at the st venice international film festival.

petrovich  (russian: uuduuuuu ufuuuueuuuu uuufuuuuduuu; born  february ) is a russian film director and screenwriter. he is mostly known for his  film the return, which won him a golden lion at the venice film festival. following the return,  directed the banishment and elena. his film leviathan was nominated for the academy award for best foreign film in . his most recent film loveless won the jury prize at the  cannes film festival.

( october  u  september ) was a polish film director, screen writer and documentalist. he was one of the most influential artists of the post-stalinist period in the people's republic of poland. his feature films man on the tracks (czuowiek na torze, ), eroica (heroism, ), bad luck (zezowate szczuubcie, ), and passenger (pasaucerka ), are considered classics of the polish film school developed in mid-s. he died as a result of a car crash in kompina in a head-on collision with a truck.nn

witold  (polish: [ucanduubj ucvajda];  march  u  october ) was a polish film and theatre director. recipient of an honorary oscar, the palme d'or, as well as honorary golden lion and golden bear awards, he was a prominent member of the "polish film school". he was known especially for his trilogy of war films consisting of a generation (), kanau () and ashes and diamonds ().nhe is considered one of the world's most renowned filmmakers whose works chronicled his native country's political and social evolution and dealt with the myths of polish national identity offering insightful analyses of the universal element of the polish experience - the struggle to maintain dignity under the most trying circumstances.nfour of his films have been nominated for the academy award for best foreign language film: the promised land (), the maids of wilko (), man of iron () and katyu ().

ubuuawski (polish: [ucanduubj uuucwafskubi];  november  u  february ) was a polish film director and writer. he was born in lwufw, poland (now ukraine). ubuuawski often went against mainstream commercialism in his films, and enjoyed success mostly with european art-house audiences.nin the late s, he studied cinema in france. his second feature the devil () was banned in poland, and ubuuawski went to france. after the success of that most important thing: love in , he returned to poland where he spent two years making on the silver globe (). the work on this film was interrupted by the polish authorities. after that, ubuuawski moved to france where he became known for controversial and violent art-house films. ubuuawski is also known for his work with actresses including romy schneider, isabelle adjani and sophie marceau.nhis films have received awards at various international film festivals. ubuuawski had also written several novels, for example: il uetait un verger, lity bufr (a.k.a. la forueat forteresse), w oczach tygrysa, and ogrufd miuoubci.

obs (chinese: ueub; pinyin: lud un; born october , ) is a taiwanese film director, screenwriter and producer.n's earlier films, such as the wedding banquet, pushing hands, and eat drink man woman explored the relationships and conflicts between tradition and modernity, eastern and western.  also deals with repressed, hidden emotions in many of his films, including crouching tiger, hidden dragon, the ice storm, hulk, and brokeback mountain. 's work is known for its emotional charge, which critics believe is responsible for his success in offsetting cultural barriers and achieving international recognition.

on-wah, mbe (traditional chinese: uauduef; simplified chinese: ubbudue; pinyin: xud unhuue; hepburn: kyo anka; born  may ) is a hong kong film director, producer, screenwriter and actress. she is one of the most critically acclaimed hong kong new wave filmmakers. she is known for her films about social issues in hong kong.n has won numerous awards for her films, including, best director and best picture at the hong kong film awards, and best film at the asia pacific film festival. she was honored for her lifetime accomplishments at the  asian film awards.

(portuguese pronunciation: [uuucsubwmu duucautui]; april ,  u november , ) was a brazilian actor, screenwriter and film director. his film o pagador de promessas () won the golden palm at the  cannes film festival, becoming the first (and to date only) brazilian film to be so distinguished. the film was also nominated for the academy award for best foreign language film. in  "o pagador de promessas" was also awarded best film and best musical score at the san francisco international film festival and best film at the acapulco (mexico), cartagena (colombia) karlovwary (poland) and edinburgh (scotland) international film festivals. his  film the obsessed of catule was entered into the th berlin international film festival. he also was a freemason.nthe president of brazil, luis inacio lula da silva, awarded  the order of the cultural merit, brazil's highest cultural civilian honor, and the governor of sueo paulo, josue serra, awarded  the order of ipiranga, which is the stateus highest civilian honor.  was awarded titles of merit citizenship by numerous brazilian municipalities including rio de janeiro, sueo paulo and salto, his birthplace. in , the municipality of salto inaugurated a multimillion-dollar cultural and educational centre named "centro cultural e educacional  ", housing a  audience amphitheatre for film and theatrical events. the centre also displays for public view the original "golden palm" awarded to  at the  cannes film festival.n died on november , , due to complications of a stroke.

(;  november  u  february ) was a leading english film director. he collaborated successfully with playwright terence rattigan on the winslow boy () and the browning version (), among other adaptations. his other notable films include pygmalion (), french without tears (), the way to the stars () and a  adaptation of oscar wilde's the importance of being earnest.

(simplified chinese: uufua; traditional chinese: uufudd) is a singaporean film director and film producer. he found success with his debut feature film, ilo ilo (), which won the prestigious camera d'or at the  cannes film festival. he also won the th golden horse award for best feature film and best new director.

(june ,  u april , ) was an american actor and film director, most notably of films noir and westerns. as a director, he often collaborated with the cinematographer john alton and with actor james stewart in his westerns.nn

(born january , ) is an american film director and producer. initially active as a music video director, he has worked primarily in the action and thriller film subgenres, and is best known for his  academy award-winning film training day.

johannes gerrit  van willenswaard (dutch pronunciation: [ucuntun jouducuunus ucuubruat kurucbubin vun uccubualunsucubaudrt]; born  may ) is a dutch photographer, music video director, and film director. he is the creative director behind the visual output of depeche mode and u, having handled the principal promotion and sleeve photography for both bands over three decades. some of his works include music videos for depeche mode's "enjoy the silence" (), u's "one" (version ) (), bryan adams' "do i have to say the words?", nirvana's "heart-shaped box" () and coldplay's "talk" () and "viva la vida" (), as well as the ian curtis biographical film control (), the american (), and a most wanted man (), based on john le carrue's  novel of the same name.

is an indian film director, writer, producer and actor, known for his work in hindi cinema. he is widely considered the face of india's new cinematic wave and has gained a strong cult following. for his contributions to film, the government of france awarded him the ordre des arts et des lettres (knight of the order of arts and letters) in .nafter writing a television serial,  got his major break as a co-writer in ram gopal varma's crime drama satya (), and made his directorial debut with paanch, which never had a theatrical release due to censorship issues. he then went on to direct black friday (), a film based on the book by hussain zaidi about the  bombay bombings. its release was held up for two years by the central board of film certification because of the pending verdict of the case at that time, but was released in  to widespread critical appreciation. 's followup, no smoking () met with negative reviews and performed poorly at the box-office. his next venture dev.d (), a modern adaptation of devdas was a critical and commercial success; followed by the political drama gulaal (), and the thriller that girl in yellow boots (). his prominence increased with the two-part crime drama, gangs of wasseypur (). his next films were bombay talkies (), ugly () and bombay velvet (). in ,  directed raman raghav ., a film based on the serial killer raman raghav.napart from filmmaking,  serves as the member of board of the mumbai-based ngo, aangan, which helps protect vulnerable children around india. he is the founder of two film production companies:   films, phantom films with partnership from directors vikramaditya motwane and vikas bahl and producer madhu mantena.nn

(december ,  u m , ) was an american playwright, screenwriter, novelist, producer, and director who was active in radio, films, theater, and television. he generated much attention with his radio scripts, particularly the horror series lights out, and his work in radio remains the outstanding period of his career. praised as one of broadcasting's top talents, he is regarded today as a key innovator of radio drama. 's personality and ego were larger than life. radio historian john dunning wrote, "few people were ambivalent when it came to  . he was one of those intense personalities who are liked and disliked with equal fire."

(hebrew: udueud ueududcudeudf) (born december , ) is an israeli film director, screenwriter and film score composer. he is perhaps best known for directing his animated documentary film waltz with bashir as well as directing the live-action/animated film the congress. he currently plans to direct an animated drama film based on the life of anne frank during the holocaust.

(french: [gati]; january ,  u april , ) was a french playwright, poet, journalist, screenwriter, filmmaker and world war ii resistance fighter. his debut film enclosure was entered into the nd moscow international film festival where he won the silver prize for best director. two years later, his film el otro cristufbal was entered into the  cannes film festival.nin  he was awarded the grand prix du thueuetre de l'acaduemie franueaise.
(french: [auno depleuubu]; born  october ) is a french film director and screenwriter.nn

hiller  (september ,  u september , ) was an american director and producer of film, television and theater.  directed critically acclaimed films throughout the s such as the drama the chase (), the biographical crime film bonnie and clyde () and the comedy alice's restaurant (). he also got attention for his revisionist western little big man ().nby the mid-s his films were received with much less enthusiasm. in the s he returned to stage and television direction and production, including an executive producer role for the crime series law & order.

(persian: uuuau uuuuufuccueue; persian pronunciation: [uesuueue ub fueuehudiud]  pronunciation  born  may ) is an iranian film director and screenwriter. among other awards, he has received a golden globe award as well as two academy awards for best foreign language film for his movies a separation and the salesman in  and , respectively. he was named one of the  most influential people in the world by time magazine in .

, cc (born july , ) is a canadian stage and film director, writer and producer.  made his career breakthrough with exotica (), a film set primarily in and around the fictional exotica strip club. 's most critically acclaimed film is the drama the sweet hereafter (), for which he received two academy award nominations, and his biggest commercial success is the erotic thriller chloe ().nhis work often explores themes of alienation and isolation, featuring characters whose interactions are mediated through technology, bureaucracy or other power structures. 's films often follow non-linear plot structures, in which events are placed out of sequence in order to elicit specific emotional reactions from the audience by withholding key information.nin ,  received the dan david prize for "creative rendering of the past".  later received the governor general's performing arts award, canada's highest royal honour in the performing arts, in .nhe was part of a loosely-affiliated group of filmmakers to emerge in the s from toronto known as the toronto new wave.

is an anonymous england-based graffiti artist, political activist and film director of unverified identity. their satirical street art and subversive epigrams combine dark humour with graffiti executed in a distinctive stenciling technique. 's works of political and social commentary have been featured on streets, walls, and bridges of cities throughout the world. 's work grew out of the bristol underground scene, which involved collaborations between artists and musicians.  says that they were inspired by d, a graffiti artist who later became a founding member of the english musical group massive attack.n displays their art on publicly visible surfaces such as walls and self-built physical prop pieces.  does not sell photographs or reproductions of their street graffiti, but art auctioneers have been known to attempt to sell the street art on location and leave the problem of its removal in the hands of the winning bidder.  created a documentary film, exit through the gift shop, billed as "the world's first street art disaster movie", which made its debut at the  sundance film festival. the film was released in the uk on  march . in january ,  was nominated for the academy award for best documentary for the film. in ,  was awarded person of the year at the  webby awards.
